titleStmt.title: The key of Scripture-prophecies: or, A glass of some new discoveries. Being an answer to a book published by Mr John Elmestone. Wherein is resolved, 1. Whether a true constituted church, with true office and visible membership, together with the ordinances proper to such a Gospel-stating, continued true by a line of succession from the primitive time downward to our times: or whether it were not interrupted by the apostacie. 2. If they did there intermit, when they return again to their first glory, whether now, or hereafter; and what is the dispensation now approved by the Spirit. / By Simon Henden.
titleStmt.author: Henden, Simon.

titleStmt.title: The key of Scripture-prophecies: or, A glass of some new discoveries. Being an answer to a book published by Mr John Elmestone. Wherein is resolved, 1. Whether a true constituted church, with true office and visible membership, together with the ordinances proper to such a Gospel-stating, continued true by a line of succession from the primitive time downward to our times: or whether it were not interrupted by the apostacie. 2. If they did there intermit, when they return again to their first glory, whether now, or hereafter; and what is the dispensation now approved by the Spirit. / By Simon Henden.
titleStmt.author: Henden, Simon.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Ja. Cottrel, for Giles Calvert, at the Black Spread-Eagle at the West-end of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: A reply to an unidentified work by John Elmeston.
The words "1. Whether a true .. Spirit." are bracketed together on title page.
The last four pages are misnumbered 91, 90, 95, 94.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
